name: Oxford - city and university Trivia Game | England | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following rivers does NOT flow through Oxford?
questions.explanation:
Severn.

	The Isis is the name given to the Thames in Oxford.

questions.text: Who gave his name to Oxford's main hospitals (Clue - same first name initials as "Dallas" TV villain)?
questions.explanation:
John Radcliffe & Radcliffe.

	John Radcliffe gave his name to the John Radcliffe Hospital in Headington and the Radcliffe Infirmary in Summertown.

questions.text: Oxford University is world famous. What is Oxford's other university called?
questions.explanation:
Oxford Brookes.

	Oxford Brookes (formerly Oxford Polytechnic) is in Headington just outside the City Centre. Lady Spencer Churchill is a former teacher training college, now part of Oxford Brookes University.

questions.text: Which Oxford college is the home of Oxford's cathedral?
questions.explanation:
Christ Church.

	The chapel of Christ Church college serves Oxfordshire, Buckinhamshire and Berkshire as their Anglican cathedral.

Debating society.

	The Oxford Union is a debating society and dining club, supposedly the training ground for future prime ministers.

questions.text: What is the name of Oxford University Library?
questions.explanation:
Bodleian.

	Named after Sir Thomas Bodley.

questions.text: What activity is pursued through OUDS?
questions.explanation:
Acting.

	OUDS stands for Oxford University Dramatic Society.

questions.text: What popular fictional police detective is based in Oxford?
questions.explanation:
Inspector Morse.

	Inspector Morse, in the novels of Colin Dexter, is played in the TV adaptation by John Thaw.

questions.text: What kind of building is the University's 'Radcliffe Camera'?
questions.explanation:
Library.

	It is a circular, three-tiered reading room, linked underground to the main Bodleian library.

questions.text: The university and tourism apart, Oxford's main industry is based at Cowley: what is it?
questions.explanation:
Motor manufacturing.

	Cowley is the home of the Morris Oxford, now part of the Rover group.
